instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, oil, milk, and vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture and mix with a silicone or wooden spoon. If the batter is too thick, add 1 to 2 tablespoons of milk.
Rinse and dry the apple. Peel if desired, then dice into small chunks. Fold the apple chunks into the batter.
Prepare the crumble topping by combining softened butter, sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Mix with a fork until small to large clumps form, ensuring no dry bits remain.
Line a muffin pan with paper cups and evenly distribute the batter into 12 portions.
Sprinkle the crumble topping evenly over each muffin.
Bake for 20 to 28 minutes at 400째F (205째C), or until the tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. In most ovens, 25 minutes is sufficient.
Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
